content: The Inner Temple
Then he brought me to the sanctuary, and he measured the side pillars: six cubits wide on each side  the width of the side pillar.
The width of the entrance  ten cubits and the sides of the entrance  five cubits on each side. He also measured the length of the sanctuary, forty cubits, and the width, twenty cubits.
Then he went inside and measured  side pillar of the doorway, two cubits, and the doorway, six cubits ; and the width of the doorway, seven cubits.
And he measured its length, twenty cubits, and the width, twenty cubits, before the sanctuary; and he said to me, “This is the Most Holy Place.”
Then he measured the wall of the temple, six cubits; and the width of the side chambers, four cubits, all around the house on every side.

The side chambers were in three , one above another, and thirty in each story; and the side chambers extended to the wall which  on their inward side all around, so that they could be attached, but not be attached to the wall of the temple .

And the side chambers surrounding  were wider at each successive story. Because the structure surrounding the temple  upward by stages on all sides of the temple, for that reason the width of the temple  as it went higher; and so one went up from the lowest  to the highest by way of the second .
I saw also that the house had a raised platform all around; the foundations of the side chambers were a full rod of six long cubits .
The thickness of the outer wall of the side chambers  five cubits. But the free space between the side chambers belonging to the temple
and the  chambers  twenty cubits in width around the temple on every side.
The doorways of the side chambers toward the free space  one doorway toward the north, and another doorway toward the south; and the width of the free space  five cubits all around.
The building that  in front of the separate area at the side toward the west  seventy cubits wide; and the wall of the building  five cubits thick all around, and its length  ninety cubits.
Then he measured the temple, a hundred cubits long; the separate area with the building and its walls  also a hundred cubits long.
Also the width of the front of the temple and  the separate areas along the east  a hundred cubits.
And he measured the length of the building along the front of the separate area behind it, with a gallery on each side, a hundred cubits;  also  the inner sanctuary and the porches of the courtyard.

The thresholds, the latticed windows, and the galleries all around their three , opposite the threshold, were paneled with wood all around, and  the ground to the windows (but the windows were covered),
over the entrance, and to the inner house, and on the outside, and on all the wall all around inside and outside,  measurement.
It was carved with cherubim and palm trees; and a palm tree was between cherub and cherub, and  cherub had two faces:
a human face toward the palm tree on one side and a young lion’s face toward the palm tree on the other side; they were carved on all the house all around.
From the ground to above the entrance cherubim and palm trees were carved, as well as  the wall of the sanctuary.
The doorposts of the sanctuary were square; as for the front of the  sanctuary, the appearance  like that .
The altar  of wood, three cubits high, and its length two cubits; its corners, its base, and its sides  of wood. And he said to me, “This is the table that is before the LORD.”
The sanctuary and the  sanctuary  had a double door.
the doors had two leaves, two swinging leaves; two  for one door and two leaves for the other.
Also there were carved on them, on the doors of the main room, cherubim and palm trees like those carved on the walls; and  a threshold of wood on the front of the porch outside.
latticed windows and palm trees on one side and on the other, on the sides of the porch;  the side chambers of the house and the thresholds.
